intro: Henckelia rugosa, commonly known as the rough-hairy henckelia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and small, opposite leaves with a rough texture. Its flowers are typically white or pale pink, clustered in umbels, and it produces small, round berries. Henckelia rugosa is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
